The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.
我今天七點到學校。: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Licay han no mako cingra o no icowacowaay ko kafana’an iso a sowal, seday sa ko sowal iso to no ’Amis, mafana’ haca somowal to sowal no Ponong, Ngayngay ato Dipong.
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Pangcah, as well as Bunun, Hakka and Japanese.
我今天七點到學校。: 我問他你會哪些語言，你的阿美語說得很流利，也會說布農語、客家語和日本話。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Nalicayen fana’ sato kako, nano kaemangan cingra minanam to sowal no Dipong, o Ponong ko fafahi, i katayalan nira ’aloman ko kananaman a Ngayngay, mansa kahirahira sa ko kafana’an nira to sowal.
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is a Bunun, and he knows many Hakkas at work, so he can speak so many languages.
我今天七點到學校。: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是布農族人，而他工作上認識許多客家人，所以他會說這麼多語言。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Ya mihomong kami i, adihay ko nisowalan noya malitengay to pakayniay i taneng no litengan a likakawa no mi’adopay.
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們訪談的時候，那位老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Ano awa awa ko kafana’an niyam mitengil i, kaorira, luingen niyam i hawikidan a tingwa nga, nga’ay kami miliyaw a mitengil.
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.
我今天七點到學校。: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Awaay ko kafanafana’an no mako to niyah to a finacadan ato serangawan, pakayni to nika o Yincomin ko tireng, ngodo sa kako.
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.
我今天七點到學校。: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Matongal a matongal to ko fana’ i, mahemeken to tona o ’Amis ko tireng, o siromaay, o tadakairayan.
The more I know, the more I feel that being a ’Amis is unique and something to be proud of.
我今天七點到學校。: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為阿美族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Ano pisakalafian i, o maminokay to ko safa to fa’inayan.
My younger brother is going home this evening.
我今天七點到學校。: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Tayra i cifa kako aci fofo mi’aca to koko’, misaday to sakalafi no safa to fa’inayan.
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Mita’elif kami to pi’acaan to dateng, adihay ko kangdaway a dateng toya pi’acaan.
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Mi’aca kami to incay, koreto ato saytaw.
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Oya katihiay o paliwalay to losay a tawki, sowal sa, “koesanay ko onglay ato lopas ako. Mi’aca to miming makena!” saan.
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”
我今天七點到學校。: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Mi’aca to kami to onglay ato lopas.
We bought pineapples and peaches.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Mita’elif to kami toya paliwalay to koko’, sowal sa koya tawki, “O maan ko ’a’acaen iso? Ta’angayay a masoesoay ko koko’ anini, tolo so’ot ko cecay a koko’.”
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”
我今天七點到學校。: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: ’Atekaken ci fofo, sakaemeden ko ’aca mamaanay han nira ko tawki a milicay.
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.
我今天七點到學校。: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Kaemeday to ko ’aca saan ko sowal no tawki, cowa to kanga’ay a lowanen.
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.
我今天七點到學校。: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Oya fiyaw i katihi a tawki sowal sa, katayni mi’aca to foting ako, kaemeday a ta’angayay ko foting ako saan.
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.
我今天七點到學校。: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Ikor to, o koko’ o foting ko ma’acaay niyam, tahaloma’ mitangtang tomes sa ko dateng i cokowi.
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.
我今天七點到學校。: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Halafinay ko pitatala, to’eman to ko romi’ad.
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.
我今天七點到學校。: 等了好久，天已經黑了。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Ira to ko tingwa no safa to fa’inayan, sowal sa, safana’ sanay ko sowal no sofitay, cowa kanga’ay a pahanhan sa, liyaw no pa’aliwacan nga, nga’ayay pahanhan a minokay.
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.
我今天七點到學校。: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Adihay ko mitangtangan, pohayen ko salawinawina malacafay a komaen, sa ci fofo!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!
我今天七點到學校。: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Tahidangen to niyam ko salawinawina ato widawidang, malacafay a komaen tona sakadofah sanay a sakalafi.
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Ira ko cecay a widang ako ci Kacaw, halitawal cira to losid.
I have a classmate named Kacaw, he often forgets to bring things.
我今天七點到學校。: 我有一個同學叫Kacaw，他常常忘記帶東西。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Mitilid i, caliwen nira ko impic, sasipasip anca o ciwming no kapot.
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.
我今天七點到學校。: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Kinacecay, kinatosa, kinatolo, maolah ho pacaliw ko kapot.
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.
我今天七點到學校。: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Nikaorira, ira ko tatiihay a pinangan nira, marariday micaliw i, ca sa patikol.
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.
我今天七點到學校。: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Ikor to i, mapili’ to ko kapot a pacaliw ciraan to losid.
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.
我今天七點到學校。: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Yo cecay a romi’ad, misalama kami talapapotal.
One day, we all went on an outing together.
我今天七點到學校。: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: I fatad no lalan, sakatoma’iaw ci Kacaw, matawal nira miala ko silikami.
On the way, Kacaw wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.
我今天七點到學校。: 路途中，Kacaw想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Caliwen nira ko silikami no kapot, cowa kaala ako ko silikami han no kapot a pacako.
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn't bring them either.
我今天七點到學校。: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Tangil sa to ci Kacaw a marawraw. Keter sa cira, mana ca pacaliwen namo kako to silikami hani?
Kacaw burst into tears. He said angrily, why don't everyone lend me toilet paper!
我今天七點到學校。: Kacaw急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙？

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Sowal han no kapot, ca piala kiso to aalaen, ano pacaliwen ho kiso to losid i, cowa patikol.
The classmate told him, because you didn't bring it yourself, and you wouldn't return the things lent to you!
我今天七點到學校。: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: To cila to a mitilid, Pacelem ci Kacaw tahira i kongkoan, Patikolen to ni Kacaw ko kapot to nicaliwan a losid.
The next day at school, Kacaw arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.
我今天七點到學校。: 隔天上學，Kacaw很早就到學校了，Kacaw把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Mararaway kako han ni Kacaw ko kapot. Cowa to mamatawal ako ko losid a miala. Roma sa to, miahowiday kako to kapot to pipacaliw to losid.
kacaw apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.
我今天七點到學校。: kacaw向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: O mi’adopay ko wama ako i niyaro’.
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Yo kaemang ho kako, dadaya mahadakay ca ama ato faki, o fonos ato kowang ko nihawikidan naira.
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.
我今天七點到學校。: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Tadengal to ko romi’ad i, hawikiden to naira ko tama’ a minokay.
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.
我今天七點到學校。: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Anca o fafoy, anca o lawal, latek iraay ko tolok.
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.
我今天七點到學校。: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Sakilacen nangara ko tama’ i sacomodan no niyaro’. Palilamen nangara ko finawlan.
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Miaocil kako ci amaan, mitoor ci amaan a mi’adop.
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.
我今天七點到學校。: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Ta’angay to kako nga, hakelongen nira kako a mi’adop, san ci ama.
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Mafana’ay ko fa’inayan no niyaro’ a patalakal, misanga’ cangra to wa’il a sapitalakal, ato sa’enec a sapitalakal.
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.
我今天七點到學校。: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Mafana’ay misanga’ ko wama a to wa’il a sapitalakal. Sowal sa ko wama, o sapitalakal to tolok koni sa. Songila’en a mitapal ko naripa’an no ’a’adopen, patelien i lalan no ’a’adopen.
My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Sapitooraw to malitengay a mi’adop, misaromi’ami’ad kako a minanam misanga’ to sapitalakal. Nga, kaliki matalakal ko ’a’adopen.
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.
我今天七點到學校。: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Ma’araw no wama i, o aidahi kiso a mi’adop ano ta’angay to, han nira kako.
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Ta’angayay to kako no hatini. Ca’elayen ako ko sapana’ ato pana’ ako, mahakelong to wama a mi’adop.
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.
我今天七點到學校。: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Minokay tahira i niyaro’ i, palilamen ko finawlan to tama’.
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Sowal sa ko wama, o aahowiden ita ko pipalemed no liteng to sakaadihay no tama’ ita.
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Maosoyay kako talakongkoan i papacem.
I was late for school this morning.
我今天七點到學校。: 我早上上學遲到了。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Ya malingad i, matawalay ako ko kafang.
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.
我今天七點到學校。: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Awa ko cecacecay a mihawikidan ako.
I didn't bring anything with me.
我今天七點到學校。: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Yo mipakafana’ ko singsi i, hacafay hananay ako ko kapot a minengneng to tilid nira.
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.
我今天七點到學校。: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Yo miseking i, pacaliwan no kapot kako to impic ato sasipasip.
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.
我今天七點到學校。: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: “Manikar a lomowad, aka to kaosoy!” han no singsi kako.
The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""
我今天七點到學校。: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Si Kacaw ko tadawidang ako.
My good friend's name is Kacaw, and he is also an Amis child.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的好朋友叫Kacaw，他也是阿美族的小孩。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Itira i Matang kami a mitilid.
We study together in the Tafalong tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們一起在馬當部落讀書。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Marariday kami a malacafay a mitengil to pipakongko no malitengay, Mafana’ay kami a misano’Amis.
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Amis proficiently.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說阿美語。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: ’Kawangay a maso^soay kako, Amerekay a mangiliway ci Kacaw.
I am tall and overweight, while Kacaw is short and thin.
我今天七點到學校。: 我很高也很胖，Kacaw很矮也很瘦。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Si’icelay ci Kacaw. O kaolahan no nimanima cira.
Kacaw is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.
我今天七點到學校。: Kacaw很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: O piontokayan no kongkoan anini, adihayay ko misadayan no kongkoan to sakalalifet.
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.
我今天七點到學校。: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Malatengteng, mitenok to mali, comikay, makero ato mipana’.
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
我今天七點到學校。: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: O comikayay ko milifetan ako.
I participated in the running competition.
我今天七點到學校。: 我比賽跑步。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Toya comikay kako i, matoro’ay kako, powak sanay ko ’ilang nanitoros.
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.
我今天七點到學校。: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Kaorira, lomowad kako, miliyaw ho a comikay.
But I stood up and continued running forward.
我今天七點到學校。: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Tahira kako i paherekan i, mahemak ko tamdaw a maemin.
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.
我今天七點到學校。: 我到終點時，所有人都很開心。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Ano cowa kaalaala ko sakacecay a ngangan i, kaorira, mahemekay kako. Nawhan i, malaheciay ako ko kalalifet.
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.
我今天七點到學校。: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Nacila, miliso’ay kako ato ama ako to faki ako.
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.
我今天七點到學校。: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Madoka’ay ko oo’ no faki.
My uncle injured his foot.
我今天七點到學校。: 叔叔的腳受傷了。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Pasowalen nira kami, maofangay ko fadahong no loma’.
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.
我今天七點到學校。: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Yo misanga’ cira to fadahong i, matefaday nanifadahong.
He fell off the roof while repairing it.
我今天七點到學校。: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Paterongen no ama ci faki to titi no kolong ato ’icep.
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Malaholoholol kako ato faki i kafoti’an, adihay ko mipainian nira a kongko.
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Yo mamiliyas kako i, ’akawangay to kako, sanengseng haca saan ci faki,
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.
我今天七點到學校。: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Pacako han ako, “Ano ma’adah to ko oo’ no faki i, katayhi ho i loma’ niyam a misalama.”
I said, When your foot gets better
我今天七點到學校。: come to our house next time and visit us.""
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34141/5: 我說：「等叔叔腳好了，下次也來我們家玩。」

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: I tosa lefot tosa polo’ ira ko tosa a mihecaan, midemak ko seyfo to kayki o nga’ayay to a pakafiten ko ngangan no Yencomin i nifonsiw.
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.
我今天七點到學校。: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列名字的會議。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Mihomong kako ci Fadasan o milongcay to sefo to pipakafit to ngangan no Yencomini i nifonsiw a kapah no niyaro’ cira.
I interviewed Fadas, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.
我今天七點到學校。: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Fadas

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Matatelek to kako ato mira tona pa’aliwan a mihomong ciraan.
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Toya pihomongan i, siwkayen nira kako to sakaira no ngangan nira, mipakafana’ haca to laloma’an nira, niyaro’ nira.
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Licayen ako cira, mana pacici sa cira a mifalic to ngangan, ya matelangay a mitingkian a ngangan, cowa kanga’ay haw?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?
我今天七點到學校。: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Sowal han nira kako, cowa kamoecel ko tilid no Kowaping to todong no ngangan nira. Anca i, “Fa syen sen” hananay no tao cira, saka adihay ko kalatawaan nona pipangiha’ to ngangan.
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Fa Xian Sheng
我今天七點到學校。: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34141/5: 他對我說，因為用中文字並不能準確的傳達他的名字，其他人還會叫他「發先生」，也因此鬧出不少笑話。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Sowal sa ci Fadas, “O no Yencomin ko mitilidan a ngangan nga, o tadangangan no mita. O sakatatodong no finacadan ita, laloma’an ita, tireng ita ko ngangan ako. Saka, nanay ’aloman ko patikolay to niyah to a ngangan.”
Fadas said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group
我今天七點到學校。: our family
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34141/5: our identity. I hope more fellow tribespeople can reclaim their own names.\""
column5: Fadas說：「原住民語書寫的名字才是我們真正的名字。我的名字代表了我們的族群、我們的家族、我們的身分，希望能有更多族人找回自己的名字。」

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Nacila malacafay kako ato fofo tayra i cifa a paliwal. Adihay ko mialaan ni fofo to mipalomaan nira a dateng, halo mitangtangan nira a kakaenen.
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.
我今天七點到學校。: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Maolahay cangra to nipaliwalan no fofo a dateng. ’Alomanay ko mi’acaay to ’adiyamay ato tayaling. ’Aloman ko komaenay to mitangtangan nira a dateng.
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.
我今天七點到學校。: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和車輪茄很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Ya mitangtangan nira a paheko ato hakhak i, ’adetay. Ira ho ko misakohawan a titi no fafoy, masolot no fangsis nira ko lafang. Alaraoraod sa a misarayaray mi’aca.
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.
我今天七點到學校。: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的馬告滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊買。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Ya mitantang ko fofo i, mitahidang kako to tamdaw. Miowing kako, “Saheto o mipalomaan no fofo ako kona dateng, cowa kapaiyoen, halikien a mi’aca!”
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown
我今天七點到學校。: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34141/5: 奶奶煮東西的時候，我在旁邊招攬客人。我在一旁大喊著：「蔬菜都是自己種的，天然有機，趕快來買喔!」

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Kaliki a mapaliwal ko dateng niyam. Sowal sa ko fofo, “Iraay kiso a mipadang kira.”
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""
我今天七點到學校。: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Pakayni tona demak, mafana’ to kako to dateng no Yencomin ato kalofana’ no kakaenen, matinako haca ko roray no mipaliwalay.
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.
我今天七點到學校。: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。

Pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i kongkoan: Ma’araw ko nikaolah no fofo to no litengan a dateng, tada mairay ato malemed kako.
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
我今天七點到學校。: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
